bill_title: establish an education voucher system to pay a portion of costs paid by students enrolled in certain nonpublic schools.
keywords: Department of Education and Cultural Affairs

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish an education voucher system to pay a portion of costs paid by students enrolled in certain nonpublic schools. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Effective July 1, 2001, the State of South Dakota shall make available an education voucher, in an amount specified by the provisions of this Act, to a parent or guardian of each student enrolled in kindergarten through grade twelve, inclusive, as provided by this Act. Section 2. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) “Department,” the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs; (2) “Public school,” a school that receives a majority of its revenues from public funds; (3) “Qualified applicant”, a parent or guardian of a voucher student, whose voucher application is approved by the department; (4) “Voucher school,” an accredited, nonpublic, nongovernmental school that offers instruction at one or more grade levels from kindergarten through grade twelve, inclusive, physically located in South Dakota which provides instruction each year for at least the number of days and hours set forth in § § 13-26-2 and 13-26-2.1; which does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or disability; and which conducts academic achievement testing similar to that required for public school districts by § 13-3-55; and (5) “Voucher student,” a minor, who is enrolled in or attending a voucher school. Section 3. A parent or guardian of each kindergarten through twelfth grade student who desires to enroll in a voucher school may file a voucher application form with the department anytime before the end of the school year. The department shall issue a voucher to each qualified applicant within thirty days of the end of the school year. Section 4. To be eligible to receive an education voucher, the parent or guardian shall provide the department with information which verifies that the voucher student has met the following requirements: (1) The voucher student has attended a voucher school for the entire academic year for which the voucher is provided; (2) The voucher student has paid tuition of at least five hundred dollars to the voucher school for the academic year; (3) The voucher school has certified the attendance and payment as required in subdivisions (1) and (2). Section 5. The amount of the voucher is one-third of the per student allocation as defined in § 13-13-10.1 and adjusted for large school districts as of July 1, 2000. The voucher amount shall be adjusted each year by the index factor as defined in § 13-13-10.1. However, the amount of the voucher may not exceed the amount paid for the student to the voucher school for tuition. Section 6. For each voucher student who received a voucher, the school district in which the voucher student's parent or guardian resides may add one-third of one student to the school district's general enrollment average daily membership, as defined in § 13-13-10. Section 7. In the first year only of the education voucher program established by this Act, the amount of the voucher, as provided in section 5 of this Act, for any voucher student who attended a voucher school during the previous year shall be reduced by fifty percent. Section 8. If any voucher student attended a public school during the year prior to attending a voucher school, the amount of the educational voucher for the voucher student for the first year the voucher student is enrolled in the voucher school shall be reduced by fifty percent. Section 9. No school district is responsible for the provision of transportation for any voucher student. Section 10. If the average academic achievement test scores at a voucher school for two consecutive years fail to exceed national averages for the test, the department may decline to pay any voucher for any voucher student attending the voucher school during the next academic year. Section 11. The department shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to provide, in accordance with the provisions of this Act, for the issuance and payment of vouchers.
